definitions: before; earlier than a certain point in time
big (adjective); loudly (adverbial usage in informal speech)
slowly; in a delayed manner; late
a little; slightly; in small quantity
examples: म अस्वस्थ भएकाले थोरै मात्र खाएँ।
examplesRomanized: ma aswastha bhaekaale thorai matra khayeun.
exampleEnglish: I ate only a little since I was unwell.
There is a lot of work today.

definitions: after; later on; following a point in time
exampleEnglish: I will return home after work.

definitions: just now; right at this moment

exampleEnglish: At a glance, it looks good.
Go straight to the office from here.
His/Her house is surely over there.
The program will possibly be tomorrow.

definitions: soon; quickly; in a short time

exampleEnglish: I go to the village occasionally.
Let's talk from time to time.
After this, it became even better.

definitions: at least; minimum; not less than

exampleEnglish: I will wait at most five minutes.
The work is not that difficult.

definitions: just like that; for no special reason

exampleEnglish: Do it the same way next time.
Please send it as soon as possible.
We must wait about ten minutes.
I agreed only after fully understanding.
I could barely manage the time.

examples: सामान्यतया कक्षा सात बजे सुरु हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: samanyataya kaksha saat baje suru hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Usually, class starts at seven o'clock.
No decision has been made so far.
It was difficult; however, we did it.
There is a lot of work at this time.
It wasn't like that at that time.

examples: हुनत सजिलो छैन, तर सम्भव छ।
examplesRomanized: hunata sajilo chaina, tara sambhav chha.
exampleEnglish: Admittedly, it's not easy, but it's possible.
This is especially useful for students.
He/She did it on their own.
It is getting colder and colder.
He/She did not make a mistake deliberately.
We returned immediately after the meeting.
The team scored goals one after another.

examplesRomanized: bihan dekhi lagatar pani parirheko chha.
exampleEnglish: It has been raining continuously since morning.
On the contrary, he/she thanked us.
It is difficult; nevertheless, it is possible.
It was late; therefore I apologize.
In reality, the problem was small.
Actually, it is not like that.
Send it as soon as possible.
On the other hand, the cost decreased.

examplesRomanized: yasai gari arko charan suru hunchha.

exampleEnglish: It was completed little by little.

examplesRomanized: uniharu le aafnai rupma samadhan gare.
exampleEnglish: They solved it in their own way.
Move quickly, otherwise it will be late.
All of a sudden, the wind blew.
Decisions were made rapidly one after another.
